channel.title: Ssh on Steckerhalter's ƛ
channel.description: Recent content in Ssh on Steckerhalter's ƛ

item.title: Edititing files with Emacs via ssh and sudo
item.description: Emacs has pretty impressive remote file editing capabilites through tramp.el (Transparent Remote Access, Multiple Protocol) – especially via ssh. It is even possible to use git on a remote server through Emacs.

item.title: ssh Agent Forwarding
item.description:
Quite often it is necessary to ssh via an intermediate host if the destination host is not directly accessible through ssh. Usually people do this:

ssh user@host1
ssh host2
# you'll have to enter your password
